wrath.client

Class Assets

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.client.Assets

  • public class Assets
extends java.lang.Object
    Optional class to load assets. This class assumes that all assets are stored PROPERLY in the 'assets' and 'etc' folders. For examples, all models will be searched for in the 'assets/models' folder and all worlds will be searched for in the 'etc/worlds' folder.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • loadEntityModel

        public static Model loadEntityModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Loads a 2D or 3D model from specified name using the Entity shader. Models are always assumed to be made with triangles, and will be rendered as such.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model to be loaded. This should be the entire file name, e.g. 'model.obj'.
        Returns:
        Returns the Model object of your model.

      • loadTerrainModel

        public static Model loadTerrainModel(java.lang.String modelName)
        Loads a 2D or 3D model from specified name using the Terrain shader. Models are always assumed to be made with triangles, and will be rendered as such.
        Parameters:
        modelName - The name of the model to be loaded. This should be the entire file name, e.g. 'model.obj'.
        Returns:
        Returns the Model object of your model.

      • loadTexture

        public static Texture loadTexture(java.lang.String textureName)
        Loads a Texture object.
        Parameters:
        textureName - The name of the texture. This includes the file extension.
        Returns:
        Returns the loaded Texture object.

      • loadWorld

        public static wrath.common.world.World loadWorld(java.lang.String worldName,
                                                 wrath.common.world.WorldType type)
        Reads and returns all World data from the specified World. Returns null if corrupt/invalid.
        Parameters:
        worldName - The name of the world.
        type - The type of World to generate if one is not loaded from a file. This can be null if you know the World already exists.
        Returns:
        Returns World loaded from a file (if present), null if invalid or corrupt.
